content: hey @rylev, is there a standard process for getting feedback on our surveys before we release them?

I want to make sure the contributor survey is well polished but I'm having trouble figuring out how best to find people to take the survey, thinking about just posting on twitter asking for volunteers..

I don't want to just ask around on zulip because I think that will bias the respondents to people who are active contributors, but I am also quite interested in feedback from past contributors, potential contributors, etc
Also, I'm assuming we now have a surveyhero team setup, can you add me to that so I can port the contributor survey into it?
also also, not sure if it's better to get feedback before or after setting up the survey on surveyhero...
I'm betting on better to do it after
and then I just need to be careful to copy back the updated version of the survey back to the github repo after it's all done

Jane Lusby [she/her] said:

hey rylev, is there a standard process for getting feedback on our surveys before we release them?

Sorry I've been on vacation and just getting back now. No there is no standard process. It would be nice to write up some docs on best practices though, but we need to figure out what those are first ;-)

Jane Lusby [she/her] said:

I'm betting on better to do it after

I've built a tool for checking the consistency of survey on SurveyHero with the local version. It's probably very buggy, but I can help you do this check. https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys/tree/main/verifier
